text:
(Boats in the heart of the desert)


The relationship that arises from grabbing the mistakes of others is that of a bad person in a sleeping society

How does society sleep?

It is not so much a bed sleep as it is a deep mental sleep

Because the proliferation of grudges and denunciations leads to a lack of sense of the full responsibility of the sane person towards his colleagues, family, surroundings and environment.

And that is the worst situation a sane person can find himself in.
So how much has a society developed in a time of human setback and insensitivity to the pain of others?

There will be no financial, cultural, literary, industrial, health or security development either

Because the society that sees an obstacle lying on the path that leads to success, and does not lift the obstacle out of the safe path, is a society without conscience, and conscience is the first to be judged heavenly

Shall we bite, consider and do the good work for this generation and for those to come?
It is not the duty of the wise to obey the speech of the traitorous soul, but it is their duty to show mercy and advise each other

This will only be possible through cultural cafes, general guidance camps, or lecture halls

In order for everyone to confront everyone to convey the lively and polite discussion image without entering into verbal arguments with the aim of coming up with permanent solutions and not temporary solutions.
What falls under the umbrella of paramount importance is the mind and the issue of maintaining awareness in light of all these media storms that seek to uproot the constants of the real mind for the sake of the dead conscience.

text:
The problem is not how she speaks or how she behaves while debating, but rather what she uses as evidence to support her argument, that climate change is not occurring.

For example, according to NASA, Earth is ~149,597,870.66 kilometers away from Sun while Venus is ~108 million kilometers away from the sun, a difference in distances which cannot be labeled as "essentially the same".

These differences have major implications on how each planet behaves, which is why you cannot compare them in the way she did. It is true that Venus and Earth are similar in structure and have more or less the same amount of elements and quantities, but because Venus is so much closer to the sun, the sun heats up Venus so much that the carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases start to come out of its crust and go up in the atmosphere, where it stays indefinitely. 



Because Earth is further away from the sun than Venus is, the Earth's unaltered atmosphere is good enough to keep the sun's heat from getting greenhouse gas from the planet's crust to go into the atmosphere.

However, because of our technology and extensive killing of animals for food, we are extracting too much greenhouse from Earth's crust. This gas goes into the atmosphere, thus heating up our planet like what happened on Venus.

All living beings and technology that we have come from the Earth. Everything that makes us, the animals and the technology that we use comes from Earth. Therefore, if we build too much, burn too much and breed animals we eat too much, more greenhouse gas from the Earth goes into the atmosphere than it is supposed to, which is why climate change is real and we are making it worse by each passing day.



Therefore, stop listening to politicians that tell you that climate change isn't real as they usually say so as it benefits their businesses (so more money from them) and/or the economy. This is because many of the big businesses in our world rely on creating products that necessitate/need to pollute the Earth in order to make profit. Furthermore, meat companies breed more animals than we need to eat, especially cows, which fart greenhouse gases that heat up the Earth. Oil extracting, which results in oil from the ground being burned up (as that's how we use it in cars and other vehicles/technology) that lets out greenhouse gases.

If you want our planet to look like Venus then deny the truth, that climate change is real and that we are making it way worse than what it could have been if we didn't pollute Earth.

text: It was the best of time, it was the worst of time. One of the most iconic quotes of English Literature and also from one of my favorite novels. tonight, ladies and gentlemen, I would like to share with you briefly not a tale of two cities but a tale of two planets. Earth and Venus are essentially the same sizes, essentially the same distance from the Sun and both have exactly the same amount of carbon. The difference is that over time on Earth the carbon has been trapped in the ground in the form of coal oil natural gas whereas on Venus most of the carbon is in the atmosphere. The difference is that on Earth the average temperature is around 50 degrees whereas on Venus it is around 850 degrees, not just because it is slightly closer to the Sun. Mercury is the closest to the Sun and it is around three times cooler than Venus. This is vaguely relevant to our current strategy of especially developing nations of taking as much ground-based carbon and injecting it into the atmosphere. Ladies and gentlemen, we must responsibly consider what we will be debating over tonight. The climate crisis is something where the consequences are not local. They are global. It affects all of us and particularly as I hope to show you in the next few minutes the developing nations themselves .....

text:
I think we need to change the argument into a way that conservatives and climate deniers can actually understand, an economic and egotistical point of view.

1. Switching to alternative energy sources will create opportunities for entrepreneurs and create jobs. I have no issue allowing the free market to take the lead.

2. Switching to alternative energy will reduce the power  OPEC has over the US. This will allow us to distance ourselves from Saudi Arabia and other countries we disagree with in terms of values.

3. Improving and finding alternative energy sources will help in our journey through space, giving America and the west the lead in the final frontier.

4. Taking on the task of curbing global warming will help stop the flow of future ILLEGAL immigration. That includes less refugees since we no longer need to fund terrorist organizations/states in order to maintain a steady flow of oil.

5. Taking the lead in these fields will draw more countries into wanting to do business with us instead of risking a debt trap to China. The west is losing influence over the world, so let's show the world why we are and will always be the leaders of world.

text: This is a university. The people there are students. One of the things they learn is how to conduct a civilised debate. Such debate is what all civilisation is (or should be ) based on. You've got to teach youngsters how to debate, how to express their opinions, how to listen and analyse those of others. So the outcome of this debate may have no significance in itself, but it's an exercise of great value. In debates such as this, both sides will give their presentation speech, and then pick apart the points of the opposition. This is just part of the opening speeches in the debate. Resource consuming? Why so, more than you or I? Privileged? You know, people can get to Oxford or Cambridge with scholarships, there are all sorts of aid possible.... many people get to these universities on merit alone. You shouldn't go making sweeping generalisations about what you think they must be.

text:
Basing your argument on another planets climate is not a good idea, especially as theories on planetary evolution are constantly changing and unreliable.
Secondly, talking about "carbon" shows a lack of understanding about the topic in general. 
Thirdly, CO2 is required for plants to grow. If CO2 goes below 180ppm then plants will struggle and so will everything else that relies on plants. Also, CO2 needs to double each time to get a 1 degree rise in global temperature. Meaning, if CO2 is 220 ppm (pre-industrial), then a 1 degree rise means you need 440 ppm of CO2. To get to 5 degrees of warming you would need 7040 ppm of CO2.
She's young and unfortunately has been educated by activist rather than teachers, so she's had a bad start right out of the gate, hopefully she will learn to think for herself.

text:
How could she highlight the problem of few states as the whole of the India? India is too big in terms of it's physiography. Come to Western Himalayan states and north eastern states to see the beauty of the nature. 
Western countries are wholly responsible for today's disasters .Instead of fulfilling their commitments they are only doing debates or lip service. 
Your industrialisation ,your prosperity ,your development came after the economic exploitation of colonies.
The whole problems in the world today are the direct or indirect outcome of your past actions. Colonies were living a better or prosper life before you. The GDP of India and China was more than 30 percent of the global GDP  during ancient time around 1000 AD.

 Ours is a unique planet having at least 32 "fine-tuned" parameters that make it life supporting. It is 2/3 covered by water and much of the land mass is covered by forests and plants. I got 1:15 into this and there are already three factual errors. 
1.  The Earth is, on average, 42 million km further from the Sun than Venus - she says that they are 'about the same distance'.  Also insolation from the Sun decreases as the inverse square of the distance so Venus is bound to be hotter.
2.  Mercury is tidally locked to the Sun.  On one hemisphere it is 400¬∞C+ and on the dark side  -170¬∞C.  Also it has virtually no atmosphere whereas Venus does so her comparison is irrelevant.


I cannot be bothered going on.  The girl has never studied any science, she knows no science and she does not understand any aspect of radiation or atmospheric physics, the solar system, meteorology, the Laws of Thermodynamics..............

author: Rakshit Sharma

text:
Another mistake you commit by quoting news articles is "factual inaccuracies".

Energy required to increase atmospheric temperature by 1C = 5 * 10^21 Joules
Energy required to increase atmospheric temperature by 0.13F(0.07C) = 0.07 * 5 * 10^21 Joules = 3.5 * 10^20 Joules
0.13F is the average temperature rise in 1 decade, so, energy equivalent per day = 3.5 * 10^20/3650 Joules = 9.5 * 10^16 Joules
Energy released by Hiroshima bomb = 6.3 * 10^13 Joules
Energy equipment per day = 9.5 *10^16/(6.3 * 10^13) = 1500 Hiroshima bombs way less than her claim of 400,000 bombs.

Now I'm not saying we don't have a problem at hand, what the people like me are pointing out is -
1) she is not a source of knowledge...her so called research is based on news articles and there are better places for actual knowledge about global warming like NOAA.
2) she's a contestant in a debate where any sane unbiased person would rate her very poor because she had a poor body language, she was factually incorrect at multiple places AND she misquoted an opponent contestant.

text:
There is nothing worse than butchering a debate by some third party who then deletes the rebuttal~~ This girl gives the stupidest argument imaginable!!!!!!  E and V are like chalk and cheese, literally!  Unlike the inorganic CO2 on Venus The carbon on earth is mostly organic. She conveniently forgets to tell you 1) that Earth rotates in about 24 hours whereas Venus rotates in the contrary sense taking 243 days. 2) Both planets have almost the same size and density but Venus is 30% closer to the Sun than Earth. 3) Venus atmosphere is 100x denser than earth. Chalk and cheese indeed!!  4) There is virtually no water on Venus
 Ours is a unique planet having at least 32 "fine-tuned" parameters that make it life supporting. It is 2/3 covered by water and much of the land mass is covered by forests and plants. Having an atmosphere containing O2 at 20% and CO2 at 0.04% the carbon cycle is uniquely balanced to support all carbon based lifeforms including the young lady!!  Anyone with half brain could do an experiment to subject a large rock to heat for 200days and compare with the same heat applied to a tree or pond of water for one day to see which is more capable of dissipating large amounts of heat. I doubt whether any of these serial activists have any idea that water vapor is 8x more effective as a greenhouse gas than CO2. 
Moreover there is ample evidence to suggest increasing our atmospheric CO2 from 1 part in 2500 (0.04%) to  1.5 in 2500 (0.06%) will do no more  than double crop yields as numerous greenhouse experiments have shown.

text:
It's not her who missed the point: it's you. 
The earth will remain alright. what about that? 
"Save the planet" doesn't mean saving a cracked up mass of gases and stones: the earth is earth because it supports life, and does it well. Sure it was a ball of fire and then of ice- it evolved. And that evolution might wipe this current species of Homo Sapiens and institute another one in it's place, but need we speed up the process? Do we have the right to take away from the future inhabitants rights to Clean air, drinkable water and a sustainable environment?
I get that Nahilism is in trend but there's seriously a place for every philosophy and this certainly is not the one for that.

text:
I deny that the so-called called climate record is a reliable record. I deny that the true record of the weather (as opposed to the ones cooked up by so-called ‚Äúscientists‚Äù) supports a claim that the weather is measurably warmer now than it was in the first half of the 20th Century. I deny that climate models are anything other than mathematical masturbation. I deny that increasing the amount of CO2 in the atmosphere has any ill effect on any biological system. I deny that the so called climate scientists are honest men. I deny that so called climate scientists have engaged in anything other than fear mongering. I deny that polar bears are in any danger from warmer weather in the arctic. I deny that sea levels are rising faster than they have in the recent past. I deny that so called ‚Äútropical‚Äù diseases have any causal relation with warmer weather. I deny that any of the weather events of the last year, or any other year are related to any changes in the general climate.

I affirm that the whole miserable theory of anthropogenic catastrophic global warming was created and advanced for the sole purpose of scaring people into surrendering their freedom, their property, and their prosperity to a global socialist government. I affirm that a warmer world is a happier, healthier, and more prosperous world. I affirm that CO2 is absolutely necessary for the existence of life on earth, and that we, and all other living things, are better off at 400 ppm than we were at 280 ppm. I affirm that it is more likely that the increase of CO2 in the atmosphere is due to the end of the Little Ice Age than it is due to human activity. I affirm that humanity would be far better off by the aggressive exploration of fossil fuel energy resources to bring prosperity to Africa and Asia, than it would be by any change in the general climate.

text:
Logical fallacies! Right off the bat, she makes the erroneous claim that Venus and Earth receive essentially the same amount of solar energy. I would not say that 2 is "essentially equal to" 1. Not even close. And Venus does receive nearly twice the solar irradiance as does Earth.

Essentially the same amount of carbon? That's also debatable. Most of the carbon on early Earth may well have been in our atmosphere. What is now oxygen (21% of the atmosphere) was previously CO2. Even before photosynthesis on Earth, Venus had some 420 times the CO2 that existed in Earth's atmosphere. Currently, that ratio is 220,000:1.

At any concentration below 4,000 ppm, CO2 remains an extremely weak greenhouse gas. We saw this with the global cooling during the 1940 to 1970 period when global cooling made the headlines with threats of a new "Ice Age," all while the world was pumping out tons more CO2 from WW2 to post-war industrialization.

We live in an Ice Age! Those 2 little white things at the poles prove that, yet people still are under the delusion that our current interglacial -- the Holocene -- is not like the other interglacials of the current Ice Age. Global Warming is a good thing, up to the complete melting of all polar ice, and beyond at least up to +20C warmer global average climate. The last time it got that warm, during the Cretaceous Thermal Maximum, with CO2 at 4,000 ppm, for 14 million years, we did not have runaway greenhouse warming. Climate was stable and life thrived.

text: She is correct that the distance to the Sun cannot explain Venus' extreme temperatures. author: Kriti J

text:
I understand it to be a rhetorical trick, but with the general ignorance of science that exists in the modern era (most people couldn't tell you the names of the planets, let alone their spatial relationship to each other), it was a careless and selfish (understandable if not forgivable in a debate) one.

Earth can be made inhospitable to our species, but it can not be crafted into a Venus by human actions. There are numerous factors at work that determine WHY (a question so many Leftists are loathe to consider in any situation) there is so much CO2 in Venus' atmosphere. In order to achieve something like that here on Earth with our plate tectonics, different geologic composition, and, yes, further distance from the sun, we'd need to get our CO2 PPM up around a staggering 30,000. To do that we'd need to burn, without ever developing mitigating technolgies, many many times more fossil fuels than exist on our entire planet.

So, should we less fossil fuels, contribute less CO2 and support alternate technolgies if we have the means to do so? Certainly. But to threaten people with the Venus twin ghost story is akin to saying the reason we shold lock up our doors at night is to keep Succubi from carrying off our husbands.

text: ¬†@fatsamcastle¬† I'll start to perform some of my critical thinking to show you what I mean. Somebody says "Climate Change is real". My mind immediately thinks what in the world does that even mean. The person has not specified whether they are talking about a man made catastrophic global warming or some moderate warming and that makes all the difference. There is no man made catastrophic global warming. Then the person starts talking about conspiracies. My mind immediately starts to ask what conspiracies are they talking about because they haven't referenced any and neither have I. My mind will then immediately recognize they are trying to bring in another logical fallacy this one not being equivocation and/or conflation, but a sort of straw man argument. I can also apply critical thinking to your last argument about fossil fuels being finite. I first ask, OK, but isn't everything finite, yes. Also, why should we use something inferior like unreliables just because we could supposedly use them forever? The answer is we shouldn't. Also, what about the claim that they are infinite? Well, it doesn't take much critical thinking to realize that while the wind and the sun may be relatively infinite, the materials used to catch them are not, such as rare earth metals, or that you would have to spread them all of the earth, or that the energy is expensive, dilute and intermittent which is why they are called  unreliable in the first place. My mind then asks, why would a person make so many obvious dishonest and/or logical errors and the reason is they are trying to advocate an ideology which is not based on reality. They are advocating some political ideology like anti-capitalism in one form or another which is manifest in such examples as Environmentalism, which is a particularly evil religion. There are two main arguments today against Capitalism. The first is the Climate Change argument and the second is the inequality argument. Thankfully Yaron Brook and Alex Epstein have now written the books "The Moral Case for Fossil Fuels" and "Equal is unfair", respectively, to address these arguments.
